docs.snippet: Brown, coach of the Philadelphia 76ers (the worst team in the league), and Kerr, coach of the Golden State Warriors (the best team on the planet), find themselves in disparate roles....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brown, coach of the Philadelphia 76ers (the worst team in the league), and Kerr, coach of the Golden State Warriors (the best team on the planet), find themselves in disparate roles.
docs.abstract: Scott Cacciola On Pro Basketball column notes that Golden State Warriors, led by coach Steve Kerr, have become symbol of excellence and stability, while Philadelphia 76ers, led by coach Brett Brown, have become synonymous with losing; both Kerr and Brown were mentored by Gregg Popovich, head coach of San Antonio Spurs.

headline.main: Brett Brown and Steve Kerr: Coaches With Much in Common, Aside From Records
headline.print_headline: Coaches With Much in Common, Aside From Records
